Posts.Content: OMG you are such a softie! It was meant to be :D Char
Posts.Title: Amtrak

Posts.Content: Michelle, I had bilateral mastectomy June 22. I'm the 5th in my family with bc. I had ILC 6.1cm in right breast and LCIS in left breast. I had clean margins and no lymph node involvement. I had the BRCA gene test done and I was negative. Yet, the oncologist told me my chance of recurrence was 20% and that is too high in my book. I start chemo Aug 10 and if later I'm told I need rads I'll do that too. I'm 61 and plan on living as long as I can for my grandchildren ages 0-6. Good luck with your decision. Char
Posts.Title: I am so confused!

Posts.Content: I had bilateral mastectomy in June. My surgeon sent me home in a surgical bra (I did not have reconstruction). I bought 2 camisoles but the store was not covered by my insurance. They were very soft and comfy and had velcro pockets for the drains. You do need a script from dr. I also got script from him to buy mastectomy bras and prostheses a few months later. Insurance covered most of the cost. Hope you discomfort eases up soon. I did not have any lymph node involvement so the only thing I had to deal with was the drains for 10 days and then healing (I had about 75 steri strips). {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: camisole advice needed

Posts.Content: I hope you don't have any se from rads. Mine were minimal and only at the end. Sending healing thoughts your way. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Finally started rads today

Posts.Content: Hoping that rads goes quickly. Mine did. Also hoping you don't have any issues with burning. Keep using the cream and I hope all goes well! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Finally started rads today

Posts.Content: good to hear from you again and glad you are getting through Taxol without many se. I finished chemo Tuesday and didn't suffer much either. This weekend though my joints ache and legs are rubbery from the Neulasta shot. Will keep you in my thoughts as your journey continues. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: hello! it's been awhile since i've rambled on :)

Posts.Content: so good to see your smiling picture again. It's been awhile and some of us were wondering how you were doing. Hope all is well. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: hello! it's been awhile since i've rambled on :)

Posts.Content: I thought I'd let you know (I already told Jean). When I called Amanda to schedule my spa treatments (not those mentioned above) she gave me the 10% discount on my services too :D {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Hershey Spa - October 29th

Posts.Content: while I was going through chemo (Taxotere/Cytoxan - 6 rounds) and then 28 rads, my nails grew like crazy and actually got stronger than they'd ever been before. Then, I started noticing all the white ridges. My fingernails have remained strong but aren't growing as fast. My toenails are another story. My big toe got very dark but the nail actually came off mushy. It hasn't started to grow at all. The other toenails look double the thickness. It may be a long time before I can have a mani/pedi. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Fingernails, Again...

Posts.Content: all went well with your mammo today. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Mammogram today!

Posts.Content: I'm sorry to hear the news is not good. I am glad that everything is happening soon though. You will be in my prayers. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Monday's Biopsy Results

Posts.Content: so happy to read the smile on your face when you received the package. Aysemari really put this all together. Glad it gave you a reason to move forward with a renewed passion. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: A big Thank You!!!!

Posts.Content: I used Biotene toothpaste, mouthwash and throat spray; plastic silverware and drank lots of water. I never had mouth sores. I have read they can be quite painful. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Are mouth sores common with T/C?

Posts.Content: a very happy birthday and many more to come! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Today is jessiesmom1's Birthday!

Posts.Content: but when I landed in the hospital with a shattered shoulder 4 years ago I've gotten the flu shot each year since. However, my reading material also said no flu injections while undergoing treatment. I just had my 2nd chemo and my oncologist won't let my rheumatologist inject my knee with anything either. I'll just take my chances this year. Fortunately the Neulasta shot I get the day after chemo has kept my white blood cells well elevated so hopefully I won't be suseptible to anyone's germs. Char
Posts.Title: To flu or not to flu

Posts.Content: travel safely and know that we are keeping watch over you as is Moopy. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Thursday AM check-in

Posts.Content: assume it was a miscommunication. When I called the on call dr Saturday I had to unblock my phone because I had caller ID. Then the dr called me. They don't want you calling them on their personal lines. As long as you are doing well now, that's what's important. Hope you are feeling better. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: on call doctor out of line or not? your take ladies!

Posts.Content: have chemo prior to surgery I can sympathize with what your feeling. I had Invasive Lobular Carcinoma in my right breast and the tumor was 6.1 cm. My surgeon said it would have been disfiguring to say the least. I also had LCIS in the left breast and decided I wasn't going to wait around to go through 2 mastectomies. I opted for bilateral mastectomy and have not regretted it. I'm the 5th in my family with bc. My grandmother died after it metastized to her bones. That was 56 years ago. My aunt who is 90 now had a mastectomy at age 68 and is doing well. I have 2 sisters who are bc survivors although neither of them need mastectomy. I tested negative for the BRCA genes. At 61 I've decided not to have reconstruction. I purchased my "new girls" and insurance paid for them. I did meet with a ps prior to surgery and he told me I could have reconstruction many years later if I ever decided it was what I wanted. I think I'll be happy with what I have rather that go through more surgery. I had chemo #4 of 6 yesterday. It is all doable. I know this is a lot to take in. Believe in yourself and your drs and some day you'll know what you went through was worth it. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Mastectomy is my only option

Posts.Content: hang in there. Know that we are all with you. Will keep you in my thoughts and prayers. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: pre op testing

Posts.Content: My dr removed my drains 1 week post op after BLM. The drains were collecting only 10cc per day. But, when I took my first shower and saw the large swollen areas under my arm area I became concerned. I called my surgeon's office Tuesday and was told I could come in to have them drained or wait til I see him the end of the month and the fluid will eventually be absorbed into my body. I opted to wait but still wonder if I made the right decision. Char
Posts.Title: Can't seem to get rid of the Drains!

Posts.Content: So glad your drains finally came out! Yah! On to the next step, right:) Char
Posts.Title: Can't seem to get rid of the Drains!

Posts.Content: Obviously the person who said that has no clue what anyone with cancer goes through. I stopped wearing my hat last week. I went to the pharmacy to pick up a script and the pharmacist did a double take as she realized I was "topless". She remarked that my hair was coming in very nicely and it really made me feel good. People should keep their mouths shut if they don't have something positive to say, eh! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: comments

Posts.Content: Invasive Lobular Carcinoma in my right breast (6.1cm) and LCIS in the left breast. Because I'm the 5th in my family with bc I had a bilateral mastectomy in June 2010. I have decided not to do reconstruction at this time. I had my 3rd TC chemo cocktail last Tuesday and will have 1-3 more. I had no lymph node involvement so don't know yet about rads. Char
Posts.Title: IBC (Inflammatory Breast Cancer)

Posts.Content: because of my age I will probably take something else. However, my sister took Tamoxifen for 5 years 9 years ago and she didn't gain any weight. She is still thin and went through menopause. Where as I gained 80#s during menopause. I went from 118# to 198# in 3+ years. Emotions have a lot to do with it. I cried all the time and eventually went on low dose HRT. I lost 30#s last fall and after being dx gained 25#! It's a never ending weight battle. Now, 11 years later I'm here and the 3rd of 4 girls with bc. Taking medication after treatment is an evil necessity to help insure a better future for us. I love your description of getting into your jeans! I lost my figure so many years ago and had to go to elastic waisted pants )-: {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and weight gain

Posts.Content: AMEN! I know exactly what messages you are talking about. I don't think anyone meant to be offensive it just got to the point that posts were going back and forth and it started to become very personal. Those who were involved know who they are. I just sat back and kept reading them without comment. Yes, it is time to take a deep breath and remember why we're all here and that this is a place where we go for information, encouragement and yes, sometimes to vent. BUT, not at each other! Wishing all a happy weekend. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Please just LET IT GO..Thanks

Posts.Content: Cynthia. I will post pic of myself and 3 sisters next week. I am the oldest and we are only 5 1/2 years apart. I look like my dad, one sister like my mom and who knows about the other 2. lol My 2nd to the youngest sister was the first dx with DCIS and after 9 years has to go for another biopsy for her other breast. She had rads and 5 years of Tamoxifen. The sister closest in age to me had a lumpectomy, chemo and rads, Arimidex for 5 years and is 8 years out. I had bilateral mastectomy in June (ILC) and just started treatment Aug 10. Each of us has a daughter who we are all worried about. My grandmother died of breast cancer when she was 62 and my aunt was dx at age 68 had mastectomy and is still going strong at 90! My mom and youngest sister both have had benign tumors removed and we all had fibrocystic breasts! I tested negative for the BRCA gene and my sister's dr has suggested that she be tested. Char
Posts.Title: Sisters

Posts.Content: sounds high tech :-) Sure hope it works well. {[hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: My Flexi-Touch MLD is in - Get it Jan 19th

Posts.Content: I couldn't find your new pic. I have 3 sisters also. We will all be together Monday at my house for a picnic. I'll have my hubby take a pic and I'll post it. I'm the shortest and unfortunately the heaviest. 3 of us have/have had bc. Char
Posts.Title: Sisters

Posts.Content: wonderful quote. Thanks for sharing :-) Char
Posts.Title: A quote I thought I would share

Posts.Content: I'll be on the bus with a cheering squad but you won't hear me singing. Hoping all goes well. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Requesting the Pink Bus for tomorrow

Posts.Content: you are very brave and have been through a lot. Hope the rest of the journey is much easier. Keeping you in my thoughts and prayers. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: New expressions

Posts.Content: I'm glad Lesley is home where she can be surrounded by her loved ones during her last days. Will keep all of you in my prayers. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Lesley is home

Posts.Content: you've been through so much. Take the time to heal. You truly are an inspiration and a warrior. Will continue to keep you in my prayers. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Cyberknife was a BREEZE!!

Posts.Content: and wishing you many more to come! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Today is Cinkal's Birthday!

Posts.Content: AMEN! I know exactly what messages you are talking about. I don't think anyone meant to be offensive it just got to the point that posts were going back and forth and it started to become very personal. Those who were involved know who they are. I just sat back and kept reading them without comment. Yes, it is time to take a deep breath and remember why we're all here and that this is a place where we go for information, encouragement and yes, sometimes to vent. BUT, not at each other! Wishing all a happy weekend. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Please just LET IT GO..Thanks

Posts.Content: for posting the obit. I will take a look. Let us know if you hear from the family about a fund for her daughter. Char
Posts.Title: Pinkflutterby's (Libby's) Obituary

Posts.Content: that you've been through your spirit still shines through. I'm hopeful that the pain is under control and the anemia can be taken care of. Wishing you well with the 2nd opinion. Sending cyber {{hugs}}. Char
Posts.Title: Update on my reoccurence

Posts.Content: right now it is all about the little things! My dh loves watching Rachel cook up a storm. Enjoy the foods - the pickles, the cupcakes and the pizza. Tomorrow is another day so enjoy! Char
Posts.Title: Update on my reoccurence

Posts.Content: so happy to hear from you and know that you are always in our thoughts too :D Sorry to hear about the side effects. I tend to get edema in the knees and my rheumatologist is always removing fluid from them and then injecting them with cortizone. Your spirits sound positive and Reggie sure is a keeper! Post when you can...... I too had problems several days either getting onto the website or not being able to post. Dang! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Treatment plans, Side Effects, you Kindreds know, the usual!!!

Posts.Content: I went to one and received many tips and lots of goodies. ACS even gave a free wig to anyone who wanted one. Enjoy the program. Char
Posts.Title: Going to Look Good Feel Better tonight!

Posts.Content: My MO sent me for a PET scan as soon as chemo was starting. I had bilateral mastectomy in June so the PET was around Aug - Sept. I see him on Thursday and he will send me for CT scan in September. I was ER+/PR+/HER2- but 5th in my immediate family with bc. My xray (last week) instead of mammo showed nothing out of the ordinary. Yes! Char
Posts.Title: Pet Scan info

Posts.Content: says I will have 4-6 treatments and I don't know about rads yet. I've had 2 chemo treatments so I'm either 1/2 or 1/3 way done! Char
Posts.Title: Cried my eyes out tonight !!!!

Posts.Content: I feel like that sometimes too although as of today I haven't had a good cry. Last fall I lost 25#s and went down 2 clothing sizes and since my bilateral mastectomy I've gained 15#s and before surgery I gained the other 10+ back. Good thing I kept my old clothes but it kills me that I have to wear them. I feel fat and bloated and my face and bald head have acne! This certainly isn't how I planned on spending my summer. I've only had 2 treatments so far. I'm hoping that when treatment is over I get back to my previous weight. It sucks! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Cried my eyes out tonight !!!!

Posts.Content: a wonderful surprise. I'm happy for you. {hugs} Char
Posts.Title: Best Birthday Surprise!!

Posts.Content: I have very uncooperative veins and loved my Purple Power Port. It was removed just before starting rads (last month). Char
Posts.Title: any thoughts on portacaths?

Posts.Content: and many more to come! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Friday is Jd1224's Birthday!

Posts.Content: sorry, I haven't heard of it. Sure hope it works for you though! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Has anyone been on Eribulin?

Posts.Content: when my husband was truck shopping he wanted a shiny red Dodge Dakota. He ended up with a silver gray one! I don't know what the VW Tiguan looks like. I test drove a Pasat before buying my Camry. The VW dealer wasn't willing to give me much on my trade in so he lost a deal. My sister drives a Jetta and a good friend has a lime green "bug". I guess you have to be practical because of where you live. Does the Tiguan have 4 wheel drive like a Subaru? Good luck car shopping. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Aortus and his new car .. Joe here are a few suggestions for you, from your fellow Kindered Spirits

Posts.Content: for sharing your pixs. It looks so relaxing. Enjoy! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: new pix up

Posts.Content: was slightly different. I had 6 rounds of Taxotere/Cytoxan. I took 2 Dex for breakfast & dinner the day before chemo and 2 for breakfast the following 2 days. I had an increase in hunger but didn't notice any trouble sleeping. Before chemo infusion I was given saline, antinausea, Benadryl and then the 2 cocktails. Char
Posts.Title: Finished 4 rds AC Starting 4 rds Taxol Worried about mega dose of Decadron

Posts.Content: the onco nurses always said they could tell when I'm taking steroids as my Rosacea face was quite red and flushed looking. I take mine at breakfast and dinner the day before and breakfast the following 2 days. I haven't had any problems sleeping. Char
Posts.Title: Chemo Glow

Posts.Content: I too am sadened by the loss of Elizabeth Edwards as she fought bc that had metastized. I was a bit worried that those like yourself who have had it spread whether to the bone, brain or liver would start to think like you have about your own mortality. Please Meena and others do not dwell on what might be. Try to stay positive because you can live for many years to come. {[hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: RIP Elizabeth Edwards

Posts.Content: congrats on your new great grandson. Wow, my oldest grandson is going to be 7 in December. Hoping all is well with your granddaughter and new baby. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Sharing Good News - New Great Grandson (Non-breast cancer related)

Posts.Content: I'm so sorry to hear the latest news. I have no advice but will definitely continue to keep you in my thoughts and prayers. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: it's back again....... in my spinal fluid

Posts.Content: Glad you got through it but se sound awful. Hope the pain in the legs goes away. Sometimes I feel like my whole body is in pain )-: {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Has anyone been on Eribulin?

Posts.Content: and after bilateral mastectomy with no lymph node involvement my oncology surgeon didn't think I would need anything but Tamoxifen for 5 years. Well, my oncologist had a different opinion and based on the size of my tumor and family history I start chemo Tuesday. Char
Posts.Title: oncotyping

Posts.Content: I admire your strength. I'm so sorry for the news you got from your onc. Your decision to stay on the chemo and not have surgery sounds like a good one. I will keep you in my thoughts and prayers. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Next step in my journey

Posts.Content: glad your last chemo is behind you. I too start rads in January. Wishing you well. Sorry about the oven but hopefully the microwave worked well. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Last Chemo, #4 in the morning!!!!

Posts.Content: sounds like you had a lot of fun and a challenge! Because I had last chemo this week I sent my husband to do it himself. He got one that was too short! I don't care now that it's decorated. Enjoy! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Fattest Christmas Tree

Posts.Content: you've come to the right place. I hear you loud and clear regarding the summer school issue. Your daughter is probably dealing with a lot of emotions knowing what her mother went through with cancer. As for your female problems, I hope all tests are good results. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: finding things a little difficult - acupuncture update

Posts.Content: your ornament (glass heart) sounds very nice and how nice is it that you can hang it all year long. Char
Posts.Title: Scotch Freckles, thank you, thank you, thank you!!!!

Posts.Content: through so much I wish I could tell you it will get better. I'm so sorry that your wife is having so many things go wrong. I will keep you and your family in my thoughts and prayers. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: DOES IT EVER STOP????

Posts.Content: isn't this exciting. Libby sure sent you a lot of love in her package. Chenheart definitely found the child in us all. Char
Posts.Title: ~~~~Thank you Sooooooo Much Pinkflutterby!!!~~~~

Posts.Content: FYI - I am still tired from rads and I finished Feb. 15th. Take it easy and eventually you'll feel better. So happy that you're done. I was a bit itchy and actually peeled a little and then my skin was fine. I continued to apply cream to keep smooth. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Just finished radiation hooray!

Posts.Content: wonderful news! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: No Colon Cancer,Thank you Jesus

Posts.Content: and others who commented. I actually felt strange looking at myself with brown hair again. Even though I didn't like the white/gray, I had gotten used to it. If only the texture would go back to normal. Char
Posts.Title: Char

Posts.Content: may your sister rest in peace. I will continue to keep you and your family in my thoughts and prayers this holiday season. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: I Lost My Sister Today

Posts.Content: my heart goes out to you. BC can be overwhelming. Hopefully, there will be those at your cancer center who can guide you to the help you so desperatly need. I'll be praying for you and know that we're here to listen so vent all you want. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Leukemia now breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hang in there. My sister took Tamoxifen for 5 years and had one cyst removed. I had an endometrial biopsy done 2 weeks after being dx with bc. I was 11 years post menopause and had started to spot for a couple of weeks. My gyn gladly told me all was ok. Yes, internal ultrasounds are a bit weird but tell a lot. I hope your results are nothing to worry about and if a hyst is necessary might as well get it over and done with. I'll be keeping you in my thoughts and prayers. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: One step forward and two steps back?

Posts.Content: I too was touched by Claudia's message to all of us. I think we would be very happy to be Pink Princesses. As I went to radiation this morning I too was thinking about all who are getting tests or treatments. I have been very emotional lately just thinking about everyone. I join you in your toast, To Good Health. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: My Message to Chenhart

Posts.Content: It is time to dance the night away......... {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Make room for one more on the dance floor.

Posts.Content: Here's hoping you keep getting good news. The waiting for test results is always the worse. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Update on mammo freak out!

Posts.Content: you're still having issues with the "girls" )-: On a happy note, congrats on getting to the voting stage with your website. I voted :-) Char
Posts.Title: Update on Lefty and Righty the Nipsters

Posts.Content: As I look in the mirror at my 5 months post chemo hair (or lack of) I smiled reading this. Attitude is everything. My hair is only 1/2" at best and is white/grey. After coloring my hair for more than 20 years I look strange even to myself. Thanks for sharing the poem. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Attitude (e-mail from my mom)

Posts.Content: I'm sorry you're in so much pain. I'm hoping the radiation works. I met a woman who had been on Zometa infusions monthly for the past 6 years. I'm sorry it didn't work for you. I have lumbar spinal stenosis but I don't begin to understand the pain you are experiencing. Sending gentle cyber {{hugs}}. Char
Posts.Title: Update BJmom

Posts.Content: you gave me my laugh for the day! Yes, red would be vampire eyes. The pale color of your eyes is mesmerizing :-) Char
Posts.Title: The story behind the eyes...

Posts.Content: may your sister rest in peace. I will continue to keep you and your family in my thoughts and prayers this holiday season. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: I Lost My Sister Today

Posts.Content: sorry about the news your mother got. You are such a tremendous warrior for your mom. I didn't have any lymph node involvement either. My sister had lumpectomy and 7 lymph nodes involved. She had chemo TAC and rads. She has some lymphodema. Hoping that you mom gets through treatment without many side effects. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Update on mom

Posts.Content: totally understand. We'll be here when you come back. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: I have to escape for a while

Posts.Content: wrote my prescription for my prostheses and bras. I go tomorrow for my first fitting at a store called Essentials for the Special Woman. It's owned and run by a former nurse/bc survivor. My insurance gave me the name of the store as someone they will work with. Char
Posts.Title: my first plastic surgeon visit not good

Posts.Content: to you Marlene :-) Celebrate! Char
Posts.Title: Today is MarleneK's Birthday!

Posts.Content: I went to see the ps before my bilateral mastectomy. I am very overweight )-: My weight has been a rollercoaster for a few years. The ps was very kind. I was not a candidate for either flap not because of weight but because I have degenerative disc disease and broke both shoulders and have balance issues. He did however, tell me I could have reconstruction at a later date with implants. He had just done reconstruction for a woman who was 15 years out. For now I plan on getting prostheses and bras. I'm 61 and don't really relish the idea of more surgery. Good luck with getting another opinion from a ps who cares. Sending {{hugs}}, Char
Posts.Title: my first plastic surgeon visit not good

Posts.Content: have been thinking of Heidi. Hopefully we'll hear from her soon. Char
Posts.Title: I've been thinking about you Heidi - Please post when you can.

Posts.Content: it's a small world indeed! I'm so glad you met Sparkle as I'm sure she was to meet you. Us east coast girls are meeting in October and I'm so looking forward to it. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: It's a Small World - Today I Met a Sister... SPARKLE

Posts.Content: glad the flowers Ayse sent put a smile on your face. It's nice to know you're being thought of. Hope you're doing well. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: thank you so much!

Posts.Content: I had bilateral mastectomy June 2010. I spent 2 nights in the hospital. My husband made sure that all dishes I would need for the day were on the counter. As soon as I felt I could, I started raising my arms to open the cabinets. The drains were the most annoying part. Mine were taken out 10 days later. I healed well. In August I started 6 rounds of Taxotere/Cytoxan every 3 weeks followed by Neulasta shot. In Jan 2011 I started 28 rounds of radiation. I'm now one year past and had a clean xray (no more mammos). I'm scheduled for scar revision mid August to remove the angel wings. No reconstruction for me. I'm 62 now and have had 12 surgeries in 5 years. Wishing you the best and I'll keep you in my prayers. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Two cancers in one breast.....overwhelmed and scared.

Posts.Content: after mastectomy surgery, port placement or for my 1st 2 chemo's. I was unable to drive for 18 months after breaking both shoulders. I had to quit my job of 18 years and was totally dependent on others. I couldn't shower or dress myself. This was life changing for me more so than getting dx of bc! I am on SS disability because of it and have a 2# weight limit for picking anything up. Char
Posts.Title: driving

Posts.Content: I had bilateral mastectomy, then 6 rounds of Taxotere/Cytoxan and because of my family history the radiologist recommended 28 rads. (I had no lymph nodes involved in my surgery.) Char
Posts.Title: Does radiation make sense when you have already gotten chemo?

Posts.Content: I just started chemo last week but I was told I would be on Tamoxifen or Arimidex following treatment. I had bilateral mastectomy w/no lymph node involvement. I have 2 sisters who are 8 year survivors and 1 took Tamoxifen and the other Arimidex. Neither of them had side effects that would have encouraged them to stop taking the "pill". I hope this helps. Char
Posts.Title: reoccurance question

Posts.Content: my thoughts and prayers are with you. Sorry for the bad news. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Please just say a little prayer....

Posts.Content: my thoughts and prayers are with you. Sorry for the bad news. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Please just say a little prayer....

Posts.Content: used to be yello many many years ago. It has been purple for several years. My bedroom is eggplant and dark green :D I was born in February and my flower is the violet. My birthstone is amethyst. Char
Posts.Title: I thought it would be great to see what your favorite color is, so, what is your favorite color?

Posts.Content: to hear about your mom. Hoping all goes well at her mammo. At the very least you will be a great comfort to her. So far you've been a trouper. I'm so glad you posted about feeling yucky as you were getting chemo and that you felt worse the next 2 days instead of 3 days later. I'm getting very anxious as my 1st chemo is tomorrow. I took Dex this morning and will take it with dinner. Tomorrow before chemo I'll take Emend. I discovered a dilemma today. After bilateral mastectomy I bought a prosthetic camisole w/cotton boobs. Well it covers my Purple Power Port so I called the onco nurse and asked about it. She suggested I wear a button down shirt that can be undone to access port then I'll cover up. I have black sutures where the incision is and I'm swollen and bruised. So, the onco nurse called in Emla cream for me to use. Such nuisances are a real pain in the butt! Keep us posted on how you're doing. It's really comforting to chat with everyone who posts their experiences. Sending a shout out to Lauren as we go to our 1st chemo tomorrow :-0 Char
Posts.Title: 1st Chemo 2 days ago!

Posts.Content: you have fun celebrating! Rads went by pretty fast and I hope you survived it well. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: I am a rad grad! Yipee!!

Posts.Content: green hat and my claddaugh earrings and ring. My shirt had some green in it too. My mother's parents were born in Ireland. Cooking corned beef on Saturday. Happy St Paddy's Day, Char
Posts.Title: green: Who is wearing GREEN today?

Posts.Content: glad you had a chance to visit with your daughter. Sounds like you had a very nice time. I've heard about and seen pics on tv about the Mall of America. Because of my arthritis I don't like shopping anymore. I think I would make an exception to see that one though. I see my daughter almost daily because while she is student teaching I'm watching her girls during the day. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Back from vacation :)

Posts.Content: I'm glad you had the opportunity to visit Disney with your son. I'm sorry though for what you are going through with the bone mets. I hope the new chemo shrinks the tumors. I will continue to keep you in my thoughts and prayers. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Update on Bjmom1

Posts.Content: you're doing ok. I had my port placed yesterday and start chemo Tuesday. I already bought Biotene toothpaste & mouthwash. I also will be getting the Neulasta shot the day after chemo. Someone in these messages mentioned getting the shot slower than faster and it made a difference on how much it hurt. I'll ask my onco nurse about that. Hang in there! Char
Posts.Title: 1st Chemo 2 days ago!

Posts.Content: anxiety when finishing rads but was glad treatment was done. I actually had mixed emotions on being NED after xray instead of mammo. It's hard to grasp not being on a schedule of going for chemo or rads and not seeing oncs all the time. I do write in a journal. It's been 5 months since I finished rads and still journalling. You will start to heal and eventually have a new "normal". Wishing you peace of mind and hope for a better future. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Having a really hard time...

Posts.Content: congrats on doing the walk! You go girl :-) Dr. Oz has done several shows about cancer awareness. Char
Posts.Title: Walked on Sunday in Komen Walk -Run in Central Park

Posts.Content: thanks for all the info you provide us with. I have osteoarthritis and am often quite inflammed in the knees and lumbar area. I eat almost everything you listed. I'm actually going to go cut up a green and red pepper to have with some hummus. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Cancer Cells Accelerate Aging, Inflammation--new research

Posts.Content: I had bilateral mastectomy, 6 rounds of Taxotere/Cytoxan and 28 rad treatments. I started Arimidex in January and tolerating it ok. I already had arthritis pain so it's not much worse. I already had severe hot flashes and they at times are really annoying. But, I will do whatever it takes to lessen my chanches of a recurrence. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Aromasin after Chemo and Radiation

Posts.Content: you're doing all right Meena. Hope each day is a good one. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Meena .. How are you doing, our PINK WARRIOR .. We are thinking about you

Posts.Content: on finishing chemo! So happy for you. Hope rads go well. I have one more chemo to go and can't wait. Enjoy the freedom until the 15th! {[hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Finished Chemo!

Posts.Content: what a gorgeous arrangement and how sweet of JennyTwist! Enjoy! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: My New Pic

Posts.Content: (I had bilateral mastectomy) my surgeon said not to use any deodorant at all. When he gave me the ok it was several weeks later and he said as long as it did not contain any aluminum. So I went to the Health Food store and bought all natural deodorant. It works well except for wetness. I finished rads in Feb and started to use antiperpirant a month or so later. I've used antiperspirants all my life and did not feel dry enough using just deodorant. If my surgeon suggests I stop, I will. Char
Posts.Title: Deodorant vs. No Deodorant - Relationship to BC?

Posts.Content: nurse gave me a book on diet during chemo. It had guidelines for what to do if nausea occurs, how to add protein, etc. The important thing I found is to eat 5 small meals a day. Make sure you hydrate! Eat protein, veggies, fruits that you can tolerate. Adjust as you go along. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: diet

Posts.Content: I've been here since June 2010. I was dx in May and was researching the American Cancer Society website and found this wonderful message boards before my surgery. I felt so prepared for both my mastectomy, chemo and rads. Just reading real life experiences in what might happen meant more to me than I can express. These women and some husbands share so much and I for one am eternally grateful. It's also a great sounding board just to vent when you need to because we are warriors in pink! Char
Posts.Title: How long have you been on this board?

Posts.Content: so sorry to hear about your friends passing. An Irish Blessing?? At least she's not suffering any more and as you said, maybe she's doing a Irish step dance. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: With a heavy heart..

Posts.Content: You have a lot on your plate. Take a deep breath and focus on the now. I will keep you in my thoughts and prayers as you wait to find out what will be next. Hopefully all will be ok with the ultrasound. It seems to me that chemo would be able to treat all of the cancers??? {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Freaking Out

Posts.Content: that is just wonderful news! You go girl :-) Char
Posts.Title: And the News Just Gets Better

Posts.Content: news. So happy you were able to ring the bell! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Teacher says, "Every time a bell rings...

Posts.Content: thanks for letting us know about Libby. So sorry to hear, though. I'm sending positive thoughts and prayers her way. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Prayers for our Pinkflutterby

Posts.Content: so glad the results showed reduced activity. Here's hoping the markers are going down! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Get pet scans RESULTS in the am.... left out an important word!!!

Posts.Content: I'm glad you're out of the hospital but so sad to hear about your other problems. I will keep you in my thoughts and prayers. {[hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Hey checking in just got out of hospital need prayers

Posts.Content: how awesome that you were able to be part of your sister's birthing a daughter! It seems to be the name as my newest granddaughter was born Nov 4th and her name is Abigail Marie. Congrats anyways! Char
Posts.Title: The Miracle of Life.... I just had to share...

Posts.Content: Carol's info sounds right on. I applied for SSD when I had to stop working because I had broken both my shoulders. I went to the nearest SS office and was on officially on the SSD in less than a month. You will need documentation from your dr. However, they go back 6 months and I eventually got a large check. I wish you the best of luck. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: stage 4 and disability

Posts.Content: Dex 2x the day before chemo and the 2 days following along with Emend. Dex helps prepare your body for the chemo and is a steroid. Drink lots of water to hydrate yourself. The Emend is for antinausea. I get some swelling from the Dex but not as bad as I hear it can be. Wishing you well with your treatments. I had #5 on Tuesday and have 1 more to go. I also get the Neulasta shot the following day (24 hrs) which helps boost your white blood cell count. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Decadron

Posts.Content: hope you feel better soon. My whole family had the stomach bug over Christmas. At least you don't need your gall bladder. Mine has sludge in it so we're keeping an eye on it. Sorry about your friend. We've had sad news here too. Hoping you heal quickly. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: update on BJMOM

Posts.Content: your ornament sounds lovely and the chocolate yummy, so enjoy! Char
Posts.Title: Ornament Received!!!, from 4slurpee!

Posts.Content: I have similar situation. I take Arimidex. I have had osteoarthritis for more than 12 years. My Vit D tends to be on the low normal range and I already take 2,000 IU besides what I get in my calcium pill. I have one sister with osteoporosis. I have lost 3" in height and can't seem to lose weight. Degenerative disc disease in my back is now causing much pain in my lumbar area. I used to be an avid walker (2 mi a day). Now it hurts just to walk around my house. I need to get another caudal epidural soon! I've had so many drs tell me to walk and I'll feel better. Yah, right! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: pain and exercise

Posts.Content: My son & dil gave birth to my 6th grandchild this afternoon. Her name is Abigail Marie and she weighed in at 9 lbs 1.4 ozs and was 20" long. She is their 4th and the only one to go full term. She has 2 older brothers and 1 sister who all welcomed her to their family. Grandpa & I will be traveling to MA tomorrow to meet her. Can't wait! I now have 2 grandsons and 4 granddaughters. My biggest wish is that bc will be erradicated so they don't have to suffer with this disease as we have. Char
Posts.Title: Non bc celebration :-)

Posts.Content: I'm sending you cyber hugs - do you feel them??? Since you had a recurrence after 22 years I certainly hope you get good news. We need good news this week. I have shed more tears this past week reading some upsetting posts, it will be a nice change of pace to have some news to celebrate. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Had my markers drawn today

Posts.Content: my sister took Tamoxifen 9 years ago for 5 years. She had one D & C done during that time. She was in her late 40's and approaching menopause. Has not had any other problems since completing. Wishing you well. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: D & C again (just had 6mths ago)

Posts.Content: your grandmother. I'm currently getting Taxotere and Cytoxan. I've had 2 treatments and the 3rd is next week. My hair fell out day 15 after 1st treatment. I've had no nausea or constipation. I drink lots of water and use Biotene mouthwash & toothpaste. The side effects I do have are bloating accompanied with weight gain and acne on my face and bald head. I also use plastic silverware. I also get the Neulasta shot the day after chemo. The bone aches start about 3 days later but are controlled with extra strength Tylenol. As someone mentioned when the onco nurses start they watch very carefully for any adverse side effects. I'm 61 and ER/PR+ and HER2-. Char
Posts.Title: Grandmother starts chemo

Posts.Content: my sister was on Fosamax and could not tolerate the joint pain. After having recurrence of DCIS in 2010 she asked to go on Evista (????). I've been on Arimidex since January 2011. I will have another bone density done next spring and I know I can't tolerate Fosamax because of acid reflux. I do think insurance dictates what meds we can take. They always want you to try the cheapest one first and then maybe they'll cover the more expensive (newer) med. Wishing you the best. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Fosamax wkly pill vs Reclast annual infusion

Posts.Content: at the pictures on the news of the devastating rising river. I think flooding is worse than fire or tornadoes because it takes so long to receed and then the possiblility of disease. My heart goes out to all affected by Mother Nature. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: OT Please say a prayer for all those suffering from the swollen Mississippi River

Posts.Content: sorry I missed your birthday. I'm here to wish you a very belated happy birthday and many more to come! My sister's birthday was yesterday and she is a 9 year survivor. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Today is Dot53's Birthday!

Posts.Content: I'm 61 too! I've been coloring my hair since I was 40. Since being dx, I got it cut short and I've been letting the color grow out. Right now it's almost completely grey. I expect it to fall out next week since I had my first chemo 1 week ago. It will be interesting to see what our hair looks like after all is said and done. Five months is a long time though. Char
Posts.Title: This is me with 5 months of new hair.

Posts.Content: I'm so glad you were feeling good enough to get the chemo done. You only have one more to go. My sister had AC and then T, where I've had TC. I'm glad you and mom had not only your dad but your husband too to keep you company. I actually went by myself for my 3rd chemo. I read and crocheted. I don't blame you for taking your scarf off. I've been tempted as I'm always hot. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: ughh Chemo #5 and I'm sick!

Posts.Content: to the bc network. I've had a PICC line for antibiotics because of a bone infection but I had a Purple Power Port placed for my chemo. I'm sure someone will have some info to help you out. {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Ladies I need Help

Posts.Content: Me too! I just read about it today! I feel helpless and can't stop crying. Char
Posts.Title: I know I am not alone.

Posts.Content: and wishing you many more! {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: Today is survives Birthday!!!

Posts.Content: My first reaction was OMG! But after reading your whole post I was sad to read that your Fluffy had passed away. So sad...... {{hugs}} Char
Posts.Title: OT Iguana Story
